children.value: Starting from OpenSumi 3.0, it supports customizing AI capabilities through the integration of AI Native Module, including but not limited to:
Providing Agent open capabilities and quick command capabilities registration and expansion
Inline Chat capability is open, allowing for rich interaction and AI capabilities to generate or understand code within the editor
Code completion capability is open, including block completion, inline completion, and other basic capabilities
Problem diagnosis capability is open, providing detection capabilities for program runtime errors or static syntax issues
Intelligent conflict resolution capability is open
More IDE functionalities' AI capabilities will continue to be opened up in the future.
Firstly, import the AI Native module in both the browser and server layers. It is recommended to use it together with the DesignModule!
The purpose of this step is to register various AI capabilities.
Create a new contribution file and implement the AiNativeCoreContribution interface.
Inject it into the DI's Providers list or the providers configuration of a custom module.
The purpose of this step is to enable the front-end AI interactions to request services from the backend interface.
Complete example code can be found in ai.back.service.ts.
Create a new backend service file and inherit from the BaseAIBackService service.
// Here you can interact with any large model API interface
Provide the newly created AiBackService file to the Provider through dependency injection.
Now that the module introduction phase is complete, the AI capabilities are missing (for example, inline chat is not triggered, etc.).
So, it is necessary to provide various provider capabilities in AiNativeContribution.
Taking inline chat as an example, implement the registerInlineChatFeature method in AiNativeContribution.
// Obtain the registered backend service through AIBackSerivcePath
// At this point, you can directly RPC call the functions provided by the backend service
// Handle any interaction after the inline chat button is clicked here
At this point, selecting a piece of code in the editor will display the just registered inline chat button in the appropriate area.
Other capabilities' Provider API documentation is as follows:
For more detailed and complete interface definitions, see:
Provides middleware to extend some AI capabilities
Registers chat panel related rendering layers, can customize render
Registers intelligent conflict resolution related features
(model: ITextModel, position: Position, token: CancellationToken, next: (reqBean: CompletionRequestBean) => MaybePromise, completionRequestBean: CompletionRequestBean) => MaybePromise
// Custom logic based on parameter information to alter the code completion results
Registers inline chat functionality in the editor
Registers inline chat functionality in the terminal
Directly executes the action's operation, and the inline chat disappears after clicking
Provides a preview strategy for the diff editor
is a type alias indicating that the method may return a Promise or directly return a value of the corresponding type.
is a union type, indicating that the response can be any of ReplyResponse, ErrorResponse, or CancelResponse.
// Register inline chat in the editor
\`\`\`. It is required to return only the code results without explanation.
// Register inline chat in the terminal area
Registers the welcome message for the Chat panel
Registers the quick command for the Chat panel
Hello, I am your dedicated AI assistant, here to answer questions about code and help you think. You can ask me some questions about code.
Customizes the rendering of the welcome message view
Customizes the rendering of the AI session view
Customizes the rendering of the user session view
Customizes the rendering of the loading view
Customizes the rendering of the input box view
Registers the model-问答 service for resolving conflicts
Registers the provider for renaming suggestions
Complete example code can be found in
The AI Native Config-related configuration parameters can control the on/off state of all AI capabilities.
All the following capabilities are enabled by default.
Whether to enable AI capabilities to handle the problem panel
Whether to enable the AI chat assistant feature
Whether to enable the Inline Chat feature
Whether to enable the code intelligent completion feature
Whether to enable the AI intelligent conflict resolution feature
Whether to enable the AI to provide renaming suggestions feature
Whether to enable the AI terminal detection feature
Whether to enable the AI terminal command suggestion feature
Whether to merge the right panel with the left panel
Whether to use the new menu bar view
Sets the icon for the menu bar, which can be a path to an image
